intro: Neoceis microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed neoceis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
